body:
What if

Tony had the opportunity to look up all the possible timelines and chose one after fighting with Thanos.

And he just reset everything with only one change. He died when he was 3 because of the stupid accident.

He thought that it would be better for everyone.

But actually without him it was the worst timeline ever

blog.name: funny-but-no
blog.title: Funny But No
blog.description:
I write shitty fanfiction

She/Her switch

Honestly I just want validation

Prompts are closed!

Tickle blog

You can call me Yellow 💛

summary: Can you write a tickle fic where peter is a villain and tony is a hero  tony know peter is a kid and don't want to fight  but...
question: Can you write a tickle fic where peter is a villain and tony is a hero  tony know peter is a kid and don't want to fight  but peter do but then tony find out peter is a ticklish lil' boy  so he tickle peter until he give up and fell asleep on tony bc he's exhausted from the tickle attack ?
answer:
Sure! Your other one that was the same did send through but I’ll just answer it on this one.

Resolved

Fandom: Marvel

Warnings: nope

———-

Tony was walking down the sidewalk. His hands were in his pockets and he had his sunglasses on even though it was dark out. He had been at a bar and was walking back to his car. As he walked down the empty path, he heard something. Footsteps. He didn’t think too much of it, as they weren’t posing any threat to him. But it did seem weird that they sort of appeared out of no where. They were wearing an oversized trench coat and a jet black fedora. They started to walk quicker, as if they were walking towards Tony.

Tony didn’t want to die so he made a sharp turn into an alley. This is how he would know if the person was following him or just walking.

He was being followed.

Tony turned around and faced the figure. The person took off their jacket, revealing a red suit.

Oh no.

They reached up and threw off their hat, revealing their face.

“I thought you moved to Europe, Iron Man.” He said.

“Yeah? Well I thought you were done with me. Clearly you aren’t.” Tony snapped back. Peter looked up to meet his eyes. He had on his spider suit but without the mask. He slowly advanced towards Tony.

“C’mon, Pete. I’m not going to fight you. You’re just a kid! I couldn’t hurt a-“ he cut himself off as Peters fist was being thrown at Tony’s face. But, with his reflexes he’s built up over the years, he was able to grab the fist before it punched him in the face.

“Nice try, kiddo. But it’s going to take a lot more than that to-“

A simple swipe from Peters leg hitting Tony’s legs caused the older man to fall. Peter stood above him and looked down.

“I’m not leaving without a fight.” Peter growled but it was hard to take him seriously. He was just a boy. Everything he said was adorable. Tony shrugged.

“Suit yourself.” He grabbed Peter’s leg and pulled him to the ground. He started to stand up but Peter lunged on top of him. Tony was trying to grab his arms as Peter was trying to punch him. Tony pushed the boy over so that he fell down on his back. Peter webbed himself back to his feet, only to be greeted by a standing Tony Stark who knocked him back down. Tony tried to pick the boy up by taking a firm hold on his sides. He stopped due to the words that were spilling out of Peter’s mouth.

“Ack! Noho! Plehease!” Peter giggled, curling in on himself. Tony looked down at the boy in confusion. He did the same thing again and got the same response.

“Nohoho! Don’t do that!” He brought his hands up in defense. He was still laying on the ground, so he held absolutely no power against Tony.

Tony crouched down to meet the blushing boy. “Don’t do what?” He smirked. Peter, being the innocent kid he his, said the exact answer Tony was looking for.

“Tickle me!”

Tony smirked. “If you say so.” He unfolded the Spiderman and collected his wrists. He held them above his head. He started spidering his fingers in the hollows of Peters armpits. The boy kicked, as his legs were still free, but he still couldn’t stop Tony.

The older of the two drilled his fingers into Peters ribs. Peter practically screamed as he arched his back. Arching his back only exposed his ribs more so he wasn’t really doing himself a favor. Tony walked his fingers down his sides and he swirled his fingers around Peter’s stomach.

“Are spiders ticklish?” He teased as his fingers circled closer and closer to his belly button. Peter closed his eyes and laughed. He shook his head ‘no’. This made Tony smile.

“Really? So you won’t mind if I do this?” He asked as he dipped a finger into Peters navel. Peter yelled and opened his eyes.

“Oh? So spiders ARE ticklish. Hmm, well I think that means you lied to me.” Tony said as he returned his fingers to Peters navel. He dipped a finger in his belly button and wiggled it around. Peter couldn’t do much so he just laughed freely. His legs had stopped flailing because he had become so weak. But Tony wasn’t quite done.

He kept tickling the kids belly but he moved his face to Peter’s neck. With no words, he blew a raspberry right on the side of his neck. Peter squealed and tried to scrunch up his shoulders.

“Plehehease!” He yelped out. “Please what?” Tony asked as he moved his hand down to squeeze Peters knees. The boy bucked. “Stohohop tihickling me!” He cried out. Tony was seriously concidering not stopping, but, Peter was just a kid after all.

He let go of his wrists and removed his hand. Peter lied on the cement, panting and giggling lightly. Tony chuckled.

“You did say you wanted a fight. You just never specified what TYPE of fight.” This caused Peter to close his eyes and smile brightly.

“Oh shut up.”

Peter soon fell asleep. Tony was unsure what to do so he drove him back to his headquarters. He put him in the guest bedroom and left him there to rest.

Things might finally be resolved between the two.

———-

I love my ticklish boyyyyyy

blog.name: fandomsupporter
blog.title: Big Fan
blog.description: I am part of many fandoms (I mainly post mediocre Incorrect Marvel Quotes)

tags: usually Peter is on the floor because of a homework problem or something
everyone in the mcu needs hugs
summary:
Peter: *is lying on the floor of the compound in a ball*
Tony: Hey, Pete. You want coffee?
Peter: No thank you, but I’d take...
body:
Peter: *is lying on the floor of the compound in a ball*
Tony: Hey, Pete. You want coffee?
Peter: No thank you, but I’d take some hot chocolate if you have some. 
Tony: Sure...so, why are you on the floor this time?
Peter: Gun shot wound. 
Tony: WHAT??!?? WHY DIDNT YOU SAY SOMETHING?!?
Peter: You didn’t ask. I didn’t want to be rude.

dialogue.name: Peter
dialogue.label: Peter:

blog.description: My name (and not my favorite color) is Red. I'm a guy. This tumblr of mine is primarily for fannish things or esoteric amusements. Occasionally something serious or thought provoking might creep in, and that's fine by me. I like to think I'm a nice sort of bloke. I take people as they are. If you want to be friends, cool, let's be friends.

title: Painted into a Corner
body:
read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2CZxhVs

by antigrav_vector

Rhodey was still laughing his ass off over the way he’d met Nat’s boyfriends, which was annoying. Now they were hitting on him, and he couldn’t respond without pissing off his girlfriend or theirs, which was even worse.

Words: 924, Chapters: 1/1, Language: English

Series: Part 10 of Spiraling Ever Upward

  • Fandoms: The Avengers (2012), Iron Man (MCU), Captain America (MCU), Marvel, Marvel Cinematic Universe
  • Rating: Teen And Up Audiences
  • Warnings: No Archive Warnings Apply
  • Categories: F/M, M/M, Multi
  • Characters: Tony Stark, Virginia “Pepper” Potts, James “Rhodey” Rhodes, Natasha Romanov, Steve Rogers, James “Bucky” Barnes
  • Relationships: Tony Stark/Pepper Potts, Tony Stark/Pepper Potts/James “Rhodey” Rhodes, Natasha Romanov/Steve Rogers/James “Bucky” Barnes
  • Additional Tags: Alternate Universe - College/University, Alternate Universe, Alternate Universe - No Powers, POV Tony Stark, Bisexual Tony Stark, Bisexual James Rhodes, Threesome - M/M/F, Everyone Is Poly Because Avengers, Tabletop Gaming, flirting but with dice

blog.name: lovelytonys
blog.title: tony stark & mcu
blog.description: A gal who is very passionate about a red-and-gold-armor-wearing hero. Call me Kay (or K, whichever).

summary: Peter being a weird memelord and Tony being a concerned and confused father figure even though sometimes it’s ooc for both (not...
body: Peter being a weird memelord and Tony being a concerned and confused father figure even though sometimes it’s ooc for both (not to mention Peter & Shuri being best friends despite the fact they might never meet) has the same energy as Thor only talking about poptarts, Clint living in the vents, and all the Avengers living in the tower and having movie nights despite being casual friends at best. It’s 2012 all over again and no one caught it

masterlist/the best!/ buy me a coffee! / ao3!

title: reverent- stevetony
body:
summary: for @itsallavengers, my very tall lion cub friend. tony is anxious and steve helps without even knowing it. very soft. 

wc: 700+

There is no reason to be upset.

Steve is having a good time, Nat and Bucky are talking about something intently, and Clint and Peter are two peas in a pod- everyone in his life that he loves are happy, and it stands to reason that he should be to.

He’s not.

He’s jittery and he’s worried and he wants a drink, but he can’t have that, and right now he can’t have Steve either, because he’s talking to an old war buddy, and he had better things to do than see Tony worrying over nothing.

But he can’t stop, can’t stop thinking about how none of them has noticed how he hasn’t said a thing, how his best friend this night has been a sparkling apple juice. Steve had wanted the whole party to be dry, but before he could say that would be too much for his sake, Clint had remarked it for him.

And now he’s got himself as company, which is just fine. He’s not thinking about how all the people he loves are doing just fine without his input, how it’s probably making their lives better that he’s finally shutting the fuck up.

He’s been annoying them lately, he knows. 

It’s stupid anyway, the stuff he rambles about. He was talking to DUM-E about a new idea and Bruce had asked him to hush. The new coffee had come in and he’d rambled about how nice it was, and he loved it, and Nat had said she couldn’t process that in the morning.

He knows they love him, doesn’t know how to stop thinking they don’t, knows how weak they’d think he was if they knew the amount of pain it was putting him through at the thought he doesn’t have their approval or affection.

It’s too much to ask though, that the Merchant of Death could have the kind of love a family brings. He has their tolerance, and he knows that’s lucky. He’s got Steve, for know, a man he’s convinced he’s tricked into loving him, and so he can’t know the way Tony’s mind craves it.

So he trembles, drinks apple cider and watches on his own, because Steve is busy, and so is everyone else.

But Steve walks over to him, all old school charm that he doesn’t even knows he has, bashful and beautiful and just a little drunk on Thor’s mead, and smiling at him so bright it just might blind him.

“Hi,” Steve says, wrapping his arms around Tony’s waist and blue eyes so warm and fond, faces close like he wants to ask for a kiss but is too shy. 3 months on of loving Tony and he still can’t make himself kiss him without looking like he’s asking for too much.

But Tony is greedy and Steve is addictive, the feeling of him heady and warm and good and Tony needs good things. He needs Steve in a way it’s embarrassing to admit.

“Hi there gorgeous,” he says, tugging him closer, and Steve preens blushing and his head falling into Tony’s neck, and wow, his boyfriend’s more gone than he thought.

“Missed you,” and oh, there he is, warm around Tony and pulling him closer because he did, and this confuses things he was thinking of before, because Steve, beautiful, kind, incredible Steve is here loving him, present and good.

“Been right here,” he says, letting himself be tender with the man he loves. Steve looks like something plucked from a painting, too good to be real, fondness in everything he does with Tony. It’s almost reverent, the way he touches him, and it’s so unfair, because if one of them is holy, it isn’t Tony.

“Been somewhere else,” Steve says, kissing the shell of his ear.

But he’s not anywhere else right now, not really, when Steve’s so close to him, treats him like he deserves him and more, gives him the best he can.

“I love you,” Steve says, and there is going to be a night where Tony spills how insecure he feels, how his place in this makeshift family always feels like it’s resting on rubble. There’s going to be a day where he breaks open under Steve’s touch like he always was meant to. It could even be tomorrow.

Tonight though, he’s going to soften under his lover’s touch and let it heal him in ways that words can’t, and be grateful for the man  who loves him so dearly a little aloofness results in this.

He’s lucky, and he sips sparking apple juice with the love of his life, and he knows it.

I write on AO3 as lucifersfavoritechild .
Throw money at me: http://ko-fi.com/V7V6IXJK.
Long live the irondick!
...
I guess this is a Peter and Stephen stan blog now.
